channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7 takeaways from Trump's incursion into Venezuela
item.description: President Trump says the U.S. will now "run" Venezuela after capturing its leader. Here's how the politics could play out at home.

item.title: 2 police officers relive Jan. 6 through their own bodycam footage
item.description: D.C. police officers experienced some of the most intense violence during the attack on the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. We sat down with two of them...

item.title: In the U.S., hunger is often hidden. But it can still leave scars on body and mind
item.description: In the U.S., hunger is often hidden away. It looks nothing like the stereotype of a famine happening overseas. But the physical impacts on health and ...

item.title: One doctor's experience shows the battle for the future of addiction medicine
item.description: The experiences of one doctor in Louisiana reveal the tensions around trying to get people to engage in addiction treatment, even if they're not ready...

item.title: Who is in charge of Venezuela? And, what to expect from Maduro's court appearance
item.description: The U.S. forces' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas has left many people with questions. Here's what we know so fa...

item.title: Bluefin tuna fetches record $3.2m at Tokyo auction
item.description: The 243kg fish went to a man known as the Tuna King, who said "the year's first tuna brings good luck".

item.title: Congress returns amid Venezuela operation; facing deadline to avert shutdown
item.description: Lawmakers return to Washington this week, staring down an end-of-month deadline to avert another government shutdown.

item.title: Ten found guilty of cyber-bullying Brigitte Macron
item.description: A Paris court found them guilty of "malicious" bullying towards the wife of the French president.

item.title: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung meets China's Xi as he seeks to reset ties
item.description: Trade, regional security and Beijing's unofficial ban on Korean pop culture are on the agenda.

item.title: Klobuchar considering run for Minn. governor after Walz ends re-election bid
item.description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar is receiving outreach encouraging her to run for the open Minnesota governorship, following Gov. Tim Walz's Monday announcement tha...

item.title: Russia reacts to U.S. military operation in Venezuela after Trump slams Putin
item.description: Russia is condemning the U.S. operation inside Venezuela that led to Nicolás Maduro's apprehension. Nina Khrushcheva, a professor of international aff...

item.title: What to expect from Nicolás Maduro's arraignment
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, are set to be arraigned in a New York federal court on Monday afternoon. CBS News'...

item.title: Thirty-two Cubans killed during US attack on Venezuela
item.description: Cuba's president said military and intelligence operatives were providing protection to captured leader Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: 'We need Greenland': Trump repeats threat to annex Danish territory
item.description: The US president has repeatedly said he wants the island to become a part of the US.

item.title: Maduro to appear in U.S. court, Trump threatens other nations
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife appear before a federal judge in New York to face charges related to drug trafficking.

item.title: Maduro is set to make his first appearance in a US courtroom on drug trafficking charges
item.description: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is set to make his first appearance in an American courtroom.

item.title: Officers who defended the Capitol on Jan. 6 say their struggles linger, 5 years after the riot
LA residents are still battling toxic hazards a year after historic wildfires
